titleStmt.title: Foole upon foole, or, Six sortes of sottes. A flat foole, a leane foole, a merry foole, [brace] and [brace] a fatt foole, a cleane foole, a verrie foole. Shewing their liues, humours and behauiours, with their want of wit in their shew of wisdome. Not so strange as true.
titleStmt.author: Armin, Robert, fl. 1610.

titleStmt.title: Foole upon foole, or, Six sortes of sottes. A flat foole, a leane foole, a merry foole, [brace] and [brace] a fatt foole, a cleane foole, a verrie foole. Shewing their liues, humours and behauiours, with their want of wit in their shew of wisdome. Not so strange as true.
titleStmt.author: Armin, Robert, fl. 1610.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for William Ferbrand, dwelling in Popes-head Allie neare the Royall Exchange.,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Robert Armin by STC (2nd ed.).
Printer's device on t.p. (McK. 188β); headpiece, tailpiece, initial.
Imperfect: stained, faded and with print bleed-through.
Reproduction of original in: Folger Shakespeare Library.
A flat foole -- A leane foole -- A merry foole -- A fat foole -- A cleane foole -- A very foole.
